headline: Deportation Officer at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)
summary:
United States Marine Corps. Infantry Sergeant 1986-1992
United States Marine Corps. Chief Armory Custodian 1989-1992
United States Marine Corps. Military Police 1990-1991

Civilian Contractor - Sinai Egypt Supply and Logistics Supervisor 1993-1994

defaultPosition.description: As a recruiter it is my responsibility to help qualified people through the application and vetting process. As a recruiter I have no authority to to hire personnel. I assist in the application process for Deportation Officer, Mission Support (usually promoted from within) and Enforcement and Removal Assistants (ERA).
defaultPosition.title: Recruiter

positions.description: As a recruiter it is my responsibility to help qualified people through the application and vetting process. As a recruiter I have no authority to to hire personnel. I assist in the application process for Deportation Officer, Mission Support (usually promoted from within) and Enforcement and Removal Assistants (ERA).
positions.title: Recruiter

positions.description: Identify possible criminal aliens, determine Immigration priority based on criminal history and convictions. determine Alienage and Removability. Arrest, detain and process subject through the immigration process. obtain court certifications and Consulate/Embassy approved travel documentation. Remove subject from the United States and return them to their country of citizenship.
positions.title: Deportation Officer

positions.description: Locate, identify, arrest, process and remove from the United States Illegal Criminals. Property Control Officer
positions.title: Immigration Enforcement Agent

positions.description: Physical and electronic security of correctional facilities and inmates. Respond to emergencies. Account for inmates and property. Protect staff, the public and inmates.
positions.title: Correctional Officer

positions.description: I am a Marine. Once a Marine always a Marine. I was an 0311 (rifleman) assigned to Weapons Company 2nd Battalion 3rd Marines as a Heavy Machine Gunner (0332). I was a participant in the first Gulf War, assigned to Task Force Taro. We cleared the MSR (Main Supply Route) from Saudi Arabia up to Kuwait City. We stopped the Iraqi Military from entering Saudi Arabia at the Battle of Al Khafji. We crossed the burm and mind field Saddam Hussein placed at the border. We cleared Kuwait International Airport. Took 121 P.O.W.s that surrendered to my platoon and received a Hero's welcome when we arrived at Kuwait City.
positions.title: Marine
